decisions.what: Both old (BFF) and new (NV-CRM) event systems will coexist during migration without interfering with each other
decisions.context: To avoid migrating multiple clients simultaneously and allow gradual rollout of the new NV-CRM approach for subscribable addon email notifications

decisions.what: CRM team completely migrated Factor emails to NV-CRM events, no longer using BFF events
decisions.context: Part of phased migration from old BFF-based email triggering to new NV-CRM event system

decisions.what: TPT started using NV-CRM events in live environment
decisions.context: Continuing migration of brands from BFF to NV-CRM event system

decisions.what: Programs feature is being killed and customers are being migrated
decisions.context: Topic is on hold for now during customer migration

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: Brand providing subscribable add-ons, fully migrated to NV-CRM events

entities.name: ThePetsTable (TPT)
entities.context: Brand providing subscribable add-ons, migrated to NV-CRM events in staging and live

entities.name: GoodChop (GoC)
entities.context: Brand using subscribable-addons-bff on frontend but never configured Salesforce integration

entities.name: HelloFresh US
entities.context: Enabled on NV-CRM but events are not actually used

entities.name: YouFoodz
entities.context: In process of migrating to new app

entities.name: subscribable-addons-bff
entities.context: Legacy BFF service for generating addon subscription events, being deprecated

entities.name: NV-CRM
entities.context: New event service generating addon subscription change events without web client involvement

entities.name: new-ventures-bff
entities.context: New BFF architecture project with tickets in TPT board

entities.name: U047SAC2PPV
entities.context: Developer explaining subscribable addon migration, created TPT tickets

entities.name: U2D54V0UV
entities.context: Following up on GoodChop and YouFoodz migrations

entities.name: U8F7ZDAPM
entities.context: Clarifying GoodChop's use of subscribable-addons-bff on frontend

entities.name: squad-market-io
entities.context: Channel renamed from market-innovation to squad-market-io

blockers.description: subscribable-addons-bff service cannot be deprecated until all clients (including GoodChop) stop calling it
blockers.impact: Service deprecation timeline blocked; affects Factor, TPT, GoodChop, and potentially other White Label brands

blockers.description: Uncertainty about whether GoodChop frontend changes are covered by shared White Label code or require separate work
blockers.impact: GoodChop migration planning and effort estimation

action_items.task: Follow up with GoodChop about next steps for migrating away from subscribable-addons-bff
Follow up on YouFoodz migration to new app status
Verify all clients have stopped calling subscribable-addons-bff before sunsetting the service
Create Phase 2 tickets for new-ventures-bff based on Phase 1 outcomes
Add translations for dropdown to Lokalize (MIO-59)

key_context.summary: Two-phase migration from legacy BFF-based email triggering to new NV-CRM event system. Factor fully migrated, TPT in production, GoodChop and other clients need to stop using old BFF before deprecation.
key_context.relevance: Critical for service deprecation timeline and affects multiple brands (Factor, TPT, GoodChop, HelloFresh US)

key_context.summary: Old system (Web → BFF → Salesforce) and new system (Web → MSS → Kafka → NV-CRM → Salesforce) coexist during migration. CRM team controls which events trigger emails.
key_context.relevance: Enables gradual migration without breaking existing functionality across multiple brands

key_context.summary: GoodChop uses subscribable-addons-bff on frontend but never configured Salesforce integration, so doesn't need NV-CRM onboarding but must stop calling BFF.
key_context.relevance: Blocks BFF deprecation; unclear if shared White Label code changes will cover GoodChop automatically

key_context.summary: Phase 1 tickets created in TPT board (TPT-2336) with labels for tracking (nv-bff, mio-dep, not-blocker). Phase 2 tickets to be created based on Phase 1 outcomes.
key_context.relevance: Defines implementation strategy and work breakdown for Pet Food BFF architecture

summary: Discussion covers migration from legacy subscribable-addons-bff to NV-CRM event system for addon subscription emails across multiple brands (Factor complete, TPT live, GoodChop pending), with service deprecation blocked until all clients stop using old BFF. New ventures BFF project tickets created for Phase 1 implementation.
